column2: Melylynn, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I am a 24 yr old who has not had any babies yet. I had my ParaGard inserted 3 weeks ago. The insertion was uncomfortable and painful (sharp pain that radiated and made me woozy/dizzy). My doctor gave me 2 pills to take prior to insertion to soften my uterus. To insert the device the Dr. had to dilate my uterus in order to safely insert the ParaGard. Not fun. He then proceeded to measure me inside to make sure the device would fit. That was another sharp stabbing pain that made me jolt. He then inserted the Paragard, removed the dilation device and cut my strings. The procedure took about 15 minutes (which feels never ending). I felt cramping immediately (my uterus was not happy).  I felt better standing than laying down. It is definitely important to take someone with you because you never know how your body is going to react. I was unable to drive. My ParaGard was inserted during the middle of my period. The next day I felt much better (strangely aware of my groin area though). No cramping for the next two weeks. Two weeks after insertion, I got my period again. This started with the similar cramping experienced during the insertion, a bit sharp. Because I had been on the pill 2 yrs, this period started out strange. It was dark and thick. I am now on my 8th day(which is 3 days longer than my normal periods before the pill), and it is very liquid and heavy. My body is experiencing a withdrawal from the hormones of the pill and an unrecognized object in my uterus, so I forgive it. Hopefully after 2 months this will lessen. It has been interesting and somewhat nerve wrecking because this is a delicate part of a woman's body. But so far, so good. I will update my post a few months down the road and hopefully my periods will have less cramping and shorter periods (even if heavy).With the pill I experienced a huge drop in my sex drive, headaches, weight gain, and irritability. If you need a BC with no hormones, this is a great choice.
